Instructions: If you have LMS admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your People, Curriculum, Classes and Settings menus. If you have LMS report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in LMS reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

下面的屏幕截图提供了报告显示页面的基本概述。此页面上的工具允许您操作和分析现有报告中的数据，而无需更改报告设计。所以， changes made in the report display are intentionally temporary。为了永久更改报告，您必须转到报告设计，进行所需的更改，然后单击“保存报告”。
单击页面右下角的显示过滤器，您可以使用常见的过滤器类型（例如“等于”、“包含”和“开头”）来过滤显示的数据。下面的屏幕截图解释了如何应用过滤器。

The screenshot below provides a basic overview of the report display page.

Clicking Show Filter at the bottom right hand side of the page allows you to filter the data displayed using common filter types such as Equal To, Contains and Starts With. The screenshot below explains how to apply filters.

A summary report is a pre-built report that allows you to find information based on criteria entered in one or more fields shown here. The criteria can be entered by selecting one or more of the following:
  • A drop-down value
  • A radio button
  • One or more check boxes
  • A date value
  • One or more words in a text field
Note: With these reports, there is no need to use the wildcard character (%) in text field filters.

Republish Lesson: You are about to re-import PowerPoint slide images or re-upload a PowerPoint presentation. If you continue, all existing lesson cells except for question cells will be deleted and the new cells from your PowerPoint will be added. Click OK to continue with updating the lesson. If you do not wish to change the lesson at this time, click Cancel.

Supervisor approval is required for this class. Are you sure you want to enroll the selected learner(s)?
  • Enroll & Wait will enroll the learner(s) tentatively. An email will be sent to their supervisor, who must approve or reject the enrollment.
  • Override will enroll the learner(s) immediately without supervisor approval.
  • Close or Cancel will close this message without enrolling the learner(s).

Instructions: To import learners from an Excel file and enroll them in the class "#1", please follow these steps:
  1. Make sure that your Excel file contains learners' names, user IDs or email addresses in one continuous column. The names, user IDs and email addresses must match those in Frontline exactly.
  2. Indicate whether the column in your Excel file contains learners' names, user IDs or email addresses.
  3. Browse to the file's location on your computer and select it.
  4. Enter the worksheet number (e.g., 1, 2, 3), the number of the first row (e.g., 1, 2, 3) and the letter of the column (e.g., A, B, C) containing the data. If the starting row contains the column name, select the check box.
  5. Click Import.
  6. Under Successfully Imported Learners (Select to Enroll), select the learners you wish to enroll; use the Check All button to select all learners in the list.
  7. Click Save to enroll the selected learners or Cancel to start again.

Step 3: In a hot spot question, learners must click on a certain region in an image to get the question correct. These regions, which are rectangular in shape, are called hot spots. You should add multiple hot spots to your image and designate one as correct. To add a hot spot, enter the coordinates of its top left and bottom right corners. To determine the X and Y coordinates of a point, place your cursor over the point on the image and record the two numbers in the status bar at the bottom of this window. The first number is the X coordinate, and the second number is the Y coordinate. After you have entered the coordinates of each hot spot, select the correct answer and then click Next.
Note: You can use the View Hot Spots link to preview your image's hot spots.

Step 3: Essay questions do not appear in lessons; they only appear in tests. Consequently, this essay question will only be used if you create a test from this lesson's questions with the Create Test link in the Lesson Layout. After you create the test, you will need to designate a grader for its essay question(s) in Author > Tests.

Step 4: Enter the messages that will be shown after learners answer this question correctly and incorrectly and then click Finish. If you will be using a remediation cell, then it is not necessary to enter these messages.

• If you will be creating a test from this lesson's questions, then you can indicate whether this question will be shown in the lesson only, the test only or both the lesson and test.
  • If you will be using question weighting in the test, then you can enter the number of points that this question is worth.

Instructions: Search for and select a training item (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select answer choices and then click View Responses to see the learners who selected those answer choices.
Shows the percentage of correct and incorrect answers for each question in a test.
Apply filters on learners, search for and select a training item (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select a date range and then click Run Report.
Only includes training completed past the due date and overdue training assignments.
Lists training records grouped by training item within a selected date range.
Apply filters on learners and training items (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select a date range and then click Run Report.
Shows the number/percentage of complete versus incomplete training assignments within a selected date range.
Shows the total number of training records and hours within a selected date range.

Apply filters on learners and training items (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select a date range and then click Run Report.
Note: The hours are calculated using the "Hours Credit" field in Curriculum/Author > Training Items.
Shows the number/percentage of training assignments completed by the due date versus the number/percentage completed past the due date or not completed yet.
Apply filters on learners, select a date range and then click Run Report.
Allows you to select a month and year from a calendar and view learners' training assignments, training records and classes in that month.
Shows all assessments learners have taken within a selected date range and the responses to the assessments' questions.

Instructions: Select a learner and date range and then click Run Report (you can use your keyboard's CTRL key to select multiple learners). After you run the report, you can click on an assessment's title to see the responses to its questions and other details.
Lists all training items along with many of the fields in Curriculum/Author > Training Items.
Lists all skillsets along with many of the fields in Curriculum > Skillsets.
Lists all active components (training items) of skillsets along with many of the fields in Curriculum > Skillsets > Components.
Shows which components of a skillset learners have completed and which ones they have not.
分配给学习者的技能组
Shows all skillsets assigned to learners both directly and through jobs.
Shows all training records of training items in skillsets.

Allows you to print a certificate for learners who have completed all training items in a skillset. Before you run this report, a Frontline administrator must set up skillset certificates in Settings > Certificates.
Lists all jobs along with many of the fields in Curriculum > Jobs.
Lists all active components of jobs, including skillsets and training items. This report does not include the components (training items) of skillsets within jobs.
Lists all active components of jobs, including skillsets and training items. This report includes the components (training items) of skillsets within jobs.
Shows which training items in a job learners have completed and which ones they have not.
Shows the active learners and training items in each job.
Instructions: Apply job filters (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), select your report options and then click Run Report.
Lists all jobs, skillsets and training items directly assigned to learners. This report does not include the components of jobs and skillsets.
Lists all training items in learners' curriculums, including those coming from jobs and skillsets.
课程列表详情+培训记录
Lists all training items in learners' curriculums, including those coming from jobs and skillsets. This report also includes the learner's latest training record, if any, for each training item.
Lists all classes along with many of the fields in Classes > Open/Completed.
Lists all learners enrolled in open and completed classes.
Lists all completed classes within a selected date range along with the number/percentage of learners who attended each one.
Enter your training item and class filters (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary) and then click Run Report.
Lists all instructors scheduled for open and completed classes.
Lists all resources (e.g., classroom, projector) scheduled for open and completed classes.
Lists all learners with a status of "No-Show" in completed classes.
Lists all open classes within a selected date range along with the associated learners, instructors or resources.
Instructions: Enter your filters (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary) and then click Run Report.
Lists all learners on the waiting lists of open and completed classes.
Lists all class resources (e.g., classroom, projector) in Settings > Resources.
Shows the results of surveys attached to classes.
Shows all learners who answered a survey question in a certain way.
Shows all surveys learners have taken within a selected date range and the learners' responses to the surveys' questions.

Instructions: Select a learner and date range and then click Run Report (you can use your keyboard's CTRL key to select multiple learners). After you run the report, you can click on a survey's title to see the learner's responses to its questions and other details.
Note: The surveys that fall within the point range selected in Author > Surveys will be highlighted in yellow.
Select a survey and training item and then click Run Report.
Lists all accounts in Settings > Accounts.
Lists all divisions in Settings > Divisions.
Lists all companies in Settings > Companies.

Use this custom report to list Learners who have either not completed assigned training or completed it past the Due Date. You can display the number of Days Overdue for incomplete training and the number of days past due for completed training. Learners who completed training prior to the Due Date are not included.
Shows all learners' external professional certifications.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of all MOC tasks currently in a user's inbox. This will include tasks across other modules, like Action Items or MOC Sign Off notices. Use the Inbox Assigned Item field for the task name and Awaiting Action By for the assignee.

显示您拥有 LMS 管理员或报告权限的公司中即将进行和/或过期的培训。

Instructions: If you have MOC admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your MOC and Elements menus. To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

Instructions: If you have ACT admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your Action Items, Events and Elements menus. If you have ACT report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in ACT reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

Instructions: If you have CSM admin permissions to multiple companies, divisions or accounts, you can select an Admin Level to only see information from one company, division or account in your Action Items, Events and Elements menus. If you have CSM report permissions at multiple levels, you can select a Report Level to only see information at one level in CSM reports (company, division or account level). To see information from all of the companies, divisions and accounts you have access to in LMS, MOC and ACT, click Reset.

To send a notice about this #1 to affected people, select the notice recipients (learners) by clicking on Add Skillsets or Add People, select a due date and then click Send Notice. The Add Skillsets link allows you to select groups of people, or skillsets, which can be created in the LMS.

The recipients are referred to as learners, because after the notice is sent, they will see an #2-type training item under the Training tab on their desktops with the due date you select; they will be required to review the #1 and sign off (the signoff records are kept with the training item in the LMS).

If you want learners to complete another training item before signing off on the #1 notice, click Select Prerequisite to search for and select the training item. They will be required to complete the prerequisite before signing off on the notice.

Note: If your search for people returns more than 1600 results, only the first 1600 will be displayed. If your search for skillsets or prerequisites returns more than 500 results, only the first 500 will be displayed.

If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.

To Add Nodes: For People node names - Click on the Individuals radio button, enter people search criteria, click on Search button, select People, enter node order, then click on Save. For Job Title node names - Click on the Jobs radio button, enter job search criteria, select jobs, enter node order, then click on Save.
Note: You may use wildcard symbols like % in your search pattern. Node Order can be sequential or can be parallel (e.g. 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (1, 1, 2, 3). All Nodes in parallel get MOC in their 'Inbox' simultaneously. All parallel Nodes have to approve before MOC goes to next Node. If Node is a Job Title, then any person holding that Job Title must approve before MOC goes to the next Node.

PSM MOC 要求输入描述、技术基础以及环境和安全影响。
标签是预定义的单词或短语，可用于标记或标记正在处理的 MOC。
配置文件是一个模板，允许您预先定义优先级、MOC 类型、实施经理、评估要求、协作者、审批者、实施要求、附件、设备以及 MOC 类别的许多其他参数。
所有变更的详细描述，包括受影响的 PSI、COSOP、控制措施和/或受控文件。
提出变更的原因以及我们如何确保变更满足或超过相关 PHA、OEM、RAGAGEP 和/或监管机构的所有要求。
使用完整的句子描述对健康、安全或环境的积极或消极影响。这可能包括以下方面的变化：所需的个人防护装备、事故或伤害的风险、泄漏的可能性、废物产生等。
请至少注意以下其中一项：MFG、DS01、DS02、RX01、RX02、TF01、冷却器、公用设施、ChemOps 设施、EHS。
您确定此 MOC 不在 PSM 涵盖范围内吗？\n如果 MOC 适用于或影响：影响涵盖流程的工艺化学品、技术、设备、程序或设施变更，则该 MOC 被视为 PSM MOC。\n涵盖流程是EHS.046 PSM 场地适用性文档中定义。

To Add Pre-Approvers: For People names - Click on the Individuals radio button, enter people search criteria, click on Search button, select People, enter order, then click on Save. For Job Title names - Click on the Jobs radio button, enter job search criteria, select jobs, enter order, then click on Save.

Note: You may use wildcard symbols like % in your search pattern. Order can be sequential or can be parallel (e.g. 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (1, 1, 2, 3). All Pre-Approvers in parallel get MOC in their 'In Basket' simultaneously. All parallel Pre-Approvers have to approve before MOC goes to next Pre-Approver. If the Pre-Approver is a Job Title, then any person holding that Job Title must approve before MOC goes to the next Pre-Approver.

Instructions: To add approvers from a route, enter your route search criteria, click Search, select the appropriate route and then click Save.
Note: Routes are pre-defined approval patterns that you can create in Elements > Route. After searching, click on the route name to display the individuals and/or jobs in the route.

Instructions: The list of collaborators for this MOC is on the right. Select the collaborators who will also be approvers for the MOC, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.

Instructions: First choose whether you want the approvers to be individuals or jobs. Next, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people/jobs, enter order numbers and then click Save.

Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The MOC approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the MOC will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the MOC.

Instructions: To import action items from an Excel file and add them to the event #1, please follow these steps:
  1. Make sure that your Excel file contains the action item titles in one column.
  2. Browse to the file's location on your computer and select it.
  3. Enter the worksheet number (e.g., 1, 2, 3), the number of the first row (e.g., 1, 2, 3) and the letter of the column (e.g., A, B, C) containing the data. If the starting row contains the column name, select the check box.
  4. To import descriptions of your action items, select Import Descriptions. The descriptions must be in the column directly to the right of the action item titles.
  5. Click Import.
  6. Under Successfully Imported Action Items (Select to Add), select the check boxes next to the action items you wish to add; use the Check All button to select all action items in the list.
  7. Click Save to add the selected action items or Cancel to start again.

Instructions: To add default approvers from a route, enter your route search criteria, click Search, select the appropriate route and then click Save.

Instructions: First choose whether you want the default approvers to be individuals or jobs. Next, enter your search criteria (use the wildcard character (%) if necessary), click Search, select the appropriate people/jobs, enter order numbers and then click Save.
Note: The order of approvers can be sequential, parallel (e.g., 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (e.g., 1, 1, 2, 3). The event approval task will simultaneously appear on the desktops of approvers with the same order number. After all such approvers approve, the event will go to the next approver(s). If an approver is a job, then any person in that job can approve the event.

To Add Nodes: For People node names - Click on the Individuals radio button, enter people search criteria, click on Search button, select People, enter node order, then click on Save. For Job Title node names - Click on the Jobs radio button, enter job search criteria, select jobs, enter node order, then click on Save.
Note: You may use wildcard symbols like % in your search pattern. Node Order can be sequential or can be parallel (e.g. 1, 1, 1, 1) or a combination thereof (1, 1, 2, 3). All Nodes in parallel get Events in their 'In Basket' simultaneously. All parallel Nodes have to approve before Events goes to next Node. If Node is a Job Title, then any person holding that Job Title must approve before Events goes to the next Node.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of all MOCs. You can list In Process MOCs, Completed MOCs, and/or Voided MOCs by choosing YES on the ShowInProcess, ShowCompleted, and/or ShowVoided field filters.
Use this pre-built report to list all MOCs with their Title, Number, Priority, Approval Start Date and Stage. You can select an MOC from the list to see its details.
Select the Division. Enter any combination of search criteria. You may use % as a wildcard. Click Run Report. Click any MOC in the list to see the MOC Details.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC approval details for each MOC. For example, you can list Approvers who have MOCs on their Frontline desktop.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC equipment details for each MOC.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC requirement details for each MOC. For example, you can list Implementers who have not completed their assigned task.

This report, which is based on the Requirements report, was created specifically for Coffeyville. The report only includes implementation requirements of in-process Coffeyville Refinery and Fertilizer MOCs in which the "Maintenance Work Completion Confirmed in Field" requirement is complete (you can apply a filter on "Requirement Status" to see only incomplete requirements).

Use this custom report to list all the MOC requirement details including intermittent status for each MOC. For example, you can list Implementers who have entered progress with comments on their assigned task.
Use this custom report to list all the MOC Collaboration details for each MOC. For example, you can list Collaborators who have MOCs on their Frontline desktop.
MOC 行动项目详细信息
Use this custom report to create a detailed list of MOC Action Items.
Use this custom report to show ACT fields for Action Items where titles match exactly with an In Process MOC title.
Use this custom report to view data for MOCs with a particular requirement form. You can sort by, group by, apply filters on and display any of the selected form's reportable fields in the report.
Use this pre-built report to list past, scheduled emails sent by the MOC application. After running the report, you can click on a person's name to view the actual email he/she was sent.
enter your filter criteria, select a date range and email type and then click <b> Run Report </b >.
Use this report to view the training items, MOC tasks, action items, event tasks and shortcuts on a user's desktop.
Use this custom report to list Personal Agents. Most fields come from the Agent List Form.
Use this custom report to list Equipment. Most fields come from the Equipment Form.
Use this custom report to list RefCodes. Most fields come from the RefCode Form.
Use this custom report to list Requirements. Most fields come from the Requirement Form.
Use this custom report to list pre-designed approval routes. Most fields come from the Route and Route Nodes Form.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Action Items, including the complete history of each Action Item. You can list In Process Action Items, Completed Action Items and/or Voided Action Items by choosing the Yes option on the "Show In Process", "Show Completed" and/or "Show Voided" field filters.

Use this custom report to create a summarized list of Action Items, including only the most recent entry in the history of each Action Item. Use the "Awaiting Action By" field to find out whose desktop each Action Item is actually on.
Ineos Oxide 事件行动项目

This report, which is based on the Current Status of Action Items report, was created specifically for Ineos Oxide. The report only includes event action items associated with the following event forms: Audit, Carrier Review, Loss Control Tour, Loss Report, Meeting Report, Quality Message, Root Cause Investigation and Safety Prevention. The report also includes the "Type" field from these event forms.
Use this pre-built report to list Action Items with Title, Category, Number, Due Date, Priority, Assigned to Person and Status. You can further select an Action Item to see the details.
Select the Division. Enter any combination of search criteria. You may use % as a wildcard. Click Run Report. Click any Action Item in the list to see the Action Item details.

Use this pre-built report to list Action Items with their Title, Category, Number, Due Date, Priority, Assigned to Person and Status. In addition, if there are custom fields, you can list, sort and/or filter on them.
Select the Division. Customize the report. Move your cursor over Steps 1-5 in the column headers for detailed instructions for each step. Click Run Report or Export to Excel.

Use this pre-built report to list people who have received emails from the Action Tracking system. The report lists names, email addresses and the date the email was delivered. When you click on a name, Frontline displays an exact copy of the email.
Enter your filter criteria, select a date range, select the email type and then click <b> Run Report </b >.
Use this custom report to view data for action items with a particular form. You can sort by, group by, apply filters on and display any of the selected form's reportable fields in the report.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Events. You can list In Process Events, Completed Events and/or Voided Events by choosing YES on the ShowInProcess, ShowCompleted, and/or ShowVoided field filters.
Use this custom report to list all the Event approval details for each Event. For example, you can list Approvers who have Events on their Frontline desktop.
Use this custom report to list all the Event Collaboration details for each Event. For example, you can list Collaborators who have Events on their Frontline desktop.
Use this pre-built report to list all Events with their Title, Category, Type, Date Started and Stage. If you select a Event from the report list, you can see its details.

Use this custom report to view data for events with a particular form. You can sort by, group by, apply filters on and display any of the selected form's reportable fields in the report.

Use this custom report to create a detailed list of Events that use the Event Reporting EME-MGT-03 Form. The values from the user defined field check boxes will be displayed as comma-separated list.

Instructions

  • The cells (pages) of this lesson are organized into topics () in the tree on the left. Click on a topic to display the cells within it, and click on a cell to view its content and make changes to it.
  • There are three types of cells:
    • Display cells () are used for training content, including text, pictures and video.
    • Question cells () are non-graded review questions designed to test learners' understanding of the training content during the course.
    • Remediation cells () are shown after learners answer lesson questions incorrectly.
  • Note: If "Free Navigation" is enabled, learners can use the tree (accessed from the "Map" button on the course's navigation bar) to skip to any page in the course.

Lesson Layout Toolbar

  • Topic (Add, Delete and Rename): You can use these functions to add new topics, remove topics and rename them. When you add a topic, it is placed after the selected topic. To add a topic to the beginning of the lesson, select the lesson title at the top of the tree and then click Add.
  • Cell (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new cells to this lesson, move cells around and remove them. When you add or paste a cell, it is placed after the selected cell. To add/paste a cell at the beginning of a topic, select the topic and then click Add/Paste.
  • Find and Replace: Allows you to search for and replace a word or phrase within the selected lesson, topic or cell.
  • Change Edit Number: Allows you to track minor changes to this lesson.
  • Create Test: Creates a test using this lesson's questions. The test is attached to the same training item and given the same title as the lesson.
  • Organize Cells: Allows you to move cells from one topic to another.
  • Print Lesson: Displays the lesson in printable format in a new browser window.

Instructions

  • The questions (cells) of this test are organized into topics () in the tree on the left. Click on a topic to display the questions within it, and click on a question () to view it and make changes.
  • Note: If you organize the questions into multiple topics, you can configure the "Number of Questions to Ask" so that a certain number of questions is randomly selected from each topic during the test.

Test Layout Toolbar

  • Question (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new questions to this test, move questions around and remove them. When you add or paste a question, it is placed after the selected question. To add/paste a question at the beginning of a topic, select the topic and then click Add/Paste.
  • Find and Replace: Allows you to search for and replace a word or phrase within the selected test, topic or question cell.
  • Change Edit Number: Allows you to track minor changes to this test.
  • Print Test: Displays the test in printable format in a new browser window (use this feature if you want learners to take the test on paper).
  • Print Answer Key: Displays the test with the correct answers in printable format in a new browser window.
  • Import Test Questions: Allows you to import questions from another test in Frontline.

Instructions

  • The questions (cells) of this survey are organized in the tree on the left.
  • Click on a question () to view it and make changes.

Survey Layout Toolbar

  • Question (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new questions to this survey, move questions around and remove them. When you add or paste a question, it is placed after the selected question. To add/paste a question at the beginning of the survey, select the survey title at the top of the tree and then click Add/Paste.
  • Print Survey: Displays the survey in printable format in a new browser window (use this feature if you want learners to take the survey on paper).
  • Import Survey Questions: Allows you to import questions from another survey in Frontline.

Instructions

  • The questions (cells) of this assessment are organized in the tree on the left.
  • Click on a question () to view it and make changes.

Assessment Layout Toolbar

  • Question (Add, Cut, Copy, Paste and Delete): You can use these functions to add new questions to this assessment, move questions around and remove them. When you add or paste a question, it is placed after the selected question. To add/paste a question at the beginning of the assessment, select the assessment title at the top of the tree and then click Add/Paste.
  • Print Assessment: Displays the assessment in printable format in a new browser window (use this feature if you want the assessor and learner to complete the assessment on paper).
  • Import Assessment Questions: Allows you to import questions from another assessment in Frontline.

  • If you were running a report, click Return to Previous Page, check your filters and try the report again.
  • Log off Frontline, close and reopen your browser and log back in.
  • If the problem continues, please contact your main LMS/MOC/ACT administrator for assistance.

在可选的预批准阶段，所有预批准者必须使用其“预批准”桌面任务批准或拒绝 MOC 请求。如果所有预批准人均不批准，MOC 将自动作废。如果至少一位预审批者批准，MOC 将自动进入新阶段。
在可选的预批准阶段，所有预批准者必须使用其“预批准”桌面任务批准 MOC 请求。如果一位预批准人不批准，MOC 将自动作废。如果所有预审批者都批准，MOC 将自动进入新阶段。
在新阶段，发起者可以对 MOC 进行更改，然后必须开始评估、协作或批准。
在可选评估阶段，必须完成所有评估要求。这些任务完成后，发起者必须开始协作或批准。
在可选协作阶段，所有协作者都必须完成其“协作”桌面任务。协作完成后，发起者必须开始审批。
MOC一旦进入审批阶段，发起者就不能对其进行更改。在批准期间，所有批准者必须使用其“批准”桌面任务批准 MOC。如果一位批准者不批准，MOC 将自动作废。如果所有审批人都批准，MOC将自动进入实施阶段。
在实施阶段，必须完成所有关键要求和关键行动项目。这些任务完成后，实施经理必须使用他/她的“启动”桌面任务批准 MOC 的启动。
在启动阶段，必须完成所有非关键要求、非关键行动项目和 MOC 通知签核。这些任务完成后，发起者必须使用他/她的“完成”桌面任务关闭 MOC。
